    const {Render} = require("./index");
                             ~~~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2497: This module can only be referenced with ECMAScript imports/exports by turning on the 'esModuleInterop' flag and referencing its default export.
    let render = new Render();
    
    render.addRectangle();
    console.log("Objects", render.objects);
                                  ~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2339: Property 'objects' does not exist on type 'Render'.
==== rectangle.js (1 errors) ====
    class Rectangle {
        constructor() {
            console.log("I'm a rectangle!");
        }
    }
    
    module.exports = { Rectangle };
    ~~~~~~
!!! error TS2580: Cannot find name 'module'. Do you need to install type definitions for node? Try `npm i --save-dev @types/node`.
==== index.js (4 errors) ====
    const {Rectangle} = require('./rectangle');
                                ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2497: This module can only be referenced with ECMAScript imports/exports by turning on the 'esModuleInterop' flag and referencing its default export.
    
    class Render {
        constructor() {
            /**
             * Object list
             * @type {Rectangle[]}
             */
            this.objects = [];
                 ~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2339: Property 'objects' does not exist on type 'Render'.
        }
        /**
         * Adds a rectangle
         * 
         * @returns {Rectangle} the rect
         */
        addRectangle() {
            const obj = new Rectangle();
            this.objects.push(obj);
                 ~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2339: Property 'objects' does not exist on type 'Render'.
            return obj;
        }
    }
    
    module.exports = { Render };
    ~~~~~~
!!! error TS2580: Cannot find name 'module'. Do you need to install type definitions for node? Try `npm i --save-dev @types/node`.
